bill.title: Driver's license; revise provisions requiring suspension when student drops out of school.
bill.description: An Act Relating To The Suspension Of A Student's Driver's License, Intermediate License Or Temporary Learning Permit When The Student Drops Out Of School; To Amend Section 63-1-10.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Attendance Officers And School District Superintendents To Report Directly To The Department Of Public Safety When A Student Under Age 18 Is Coded As A Dropout; To Amend Section 63-1-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Parent's Written Consent For The Release Of School Attendance Records To The Department Of Public Safety When A Student Applies For A Driver's License To Include Consent To The Future Release Of Attendance Records If The Applicant Drops Out Of School; To Amend Section 63-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 63-1-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Suspend, Without A Preliminary Hearing, The Driver's License Of A Student Who Drops Out Of School; And For Related Purposes.
